citation.article-title: Haliea rubra sp. nov., a member of the Gammaproteobacteria from the Mediterranean Sea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Haliea rubra sp. nov.
Haliea rubra (ru′bra. L. fem. adj. rubra red).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile rods, 2.7±0.12 μm long and 0.5±0.05 μm wide.
Growth occurs at 15–44 °C (optimum, 30 °C), at pH 5.0–9.0 (optimum, 8.0) and at salinities in the range 7–42 g NaCl l−1 (optimum, 35 g l−1).
Positive reactions with Biolog GN2 plates are obtained for Tween 40, d-glucose, d-lactose, citrate and γ-hydroxybutyric acid.
Positive API ZYM reactions for enzyme activities are obtained for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase and acid phosphatase.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65 mol%.
The type strain, CM41_15aT (=DSM 19751T=CIP 109758T=MOLA 104T), was isolated from surface seawater in the bay of Banyuls-sur-Mer (4 ° 29′ N ° 08′ E).
